SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class SignatureModelBenchmarking

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.SignatureModel
uk.msci.project.rsa.AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking
uk.msci.project.rsa.SignatureModelBenchmarking
public class SignatureModelBenchmarking extends AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking
This class is part of the Model component specific to digital signature operations providing methods to sign batches of data and verification of batch signatures. It encapsulates the data and the logic required to keep track of a user initiated digital signature scheme.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SignatureModelBenchmarking()
    Constructs a new SignatureModel without requiring an initial key representative of the fact that at program launch, the model does not have any state: until it is initiated by the user

  • Constructor Details

    • SignatureModelBenchmarking

      public SignatureModelBenchmarking()
      Constructs a new SignatureModel without requiring an initial key representative of the fact that at program launch, the model does not have any state: until it is initiated by the user

  • Method Details

    • batchCreateSignatures

      public void batchCreateSignatures(File batchMessageFile, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Processes a batch of messages to create digital signatures using the private keys in the batch.The method also updates the progress of the batch signing process using the provided progressUpdater consumer.
      Parameters:
      batchMessageFile - The file containing the messages to be signed in the batch process.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the batch signing process.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an I/O error reading from the batchMessageFile.

    • batchVerifySignatures

      public void batchVerifySignatures(File batchMessageFile, File batchSignatureFile, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Processes a batch of messages and their corresponding signatures to verify the authenticity of the signatures using the public keys in the batch. This method updates the progress of the verification process using the progressUpdater consumer.
      Parameters:
      batchMessageFile - The file containing the messages to be verified.
      batchSignatureFile - The file containing the corresponding signatures to be verified.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the batch verification process.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an I/O error reading from the batchMessageFile.

    • batchVerifySignaturesForRecovery

      public void batchVerifySignaturesForRecovery(File batchMessageFile, File batchSignatureFile, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Processes a batch of messages and their corresponding signatures to verify the authenticity of the signatures for message recovery schemes
      Parameters:
      batchMessageFile - The file containing the messages to be verified.
      batchSignatureFile - The file containing the corresponding signatures to be verified.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the batch verification process.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an I/O error reading from the batchMessageFile.

    • exportVerificationResultsToCSV

      public void exportVerificationResultsToCSV(int keyIndex, int keySize, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Exports verification results to a CSV file for a specific key index. Each line in the file will contain the index of the key used for verification, the verification result, the original message, the signature.
      Parameters:
      keyIndex - The index of the key for which verification results are exported.
      keySize - The length of the key for which verification results are exported.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the export process.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error writing to the file.

    • exportVerificationResultsToCSVForRecovery

      public void exportVerificationResultsToCSVForRecovery(int keyIndex, int keySize, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Exports message recovery verification results to a CSV file for a specific key index. Each line in the file will contain the index of the key used for verification, the verification result, the original message, the signature, and the recovered message (if any).
      Parameters:
      keyIndex - The index of the key for which verification results are exported.
      keySize - The length of the key for which verification results are exported.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the export process.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error writing to the file.
